title: How to Have a Cupcake Baking Competition at Your House

steps.headline: Plan the competition.
steps.description: Decide on the rules, the day it'll start, who you want to participate, the time the competition will take place on, and (optional) the prizes.

steps.headline: Send out invitations.
steps.description: You'll want to send out invitations at least 1-2 weeks in advance. You can also post fliers asking for competitors.

steps.headline: Buy the materials necessary for the competition.
steps.description: At the very least, you'll want to get ingredients for baking cupcakes, cupcake tins, and toppings for the cupcakes.

steps.headline: As the day of the competition approaches, send out reminders to the participants.
steps.description: You can do this through e-mail, by letters, or any other way.

steps.headline: On the day you're holding the competition, be sure that you have your materials in your kitchen, and a few minutes before the competition starts, pre-heat the oven to the proper temperature for baking the cupcakes.
When the competitors come to your house, explain the rules of the competition, set a timer for how long they have to bake their cupcakes, and start the competition.
Moderate the competition during the baking make sure the competition is going correctly.
steps.description: Give periodic time reminders of how long the competitors have.

steps.headline: When time runs out, taste the cupcakes from each competitor, and give them feedback about their cupcakes.
steps.description: After all the cupcakes are tasted, give yourself time to figure out your winner. Once you know the winner, announce it, and then if you have any prizes, give them out to the winner.

text: Plan the competition. Decide on the rules, the day it'll start, who you want to participate, the time the competition will take place on, and (optional) the prizes. Send out invitations. You'll want to send out invitations at least 1-2 weeks in advance. You can also post fliers asking for competitors. Buy the materials necessary for the competition. At the very least, you'll want to get ingredients for baking cupcakes, cupcake tins, and toppings for the cupcakes. As the day of the competition approaches, send out reminders to the participants. You can do this through e-mail, by letters, or any other way. On the day you're holding the competition, be sure that you have your materials in your kitchen, and a few minutes before the competition starts, pre-heat the oven to the proper temperature for baking the cupcakes.  When the competitors come to your house, explain the rules of the competition, set a timer for how long they have to bake their cupcakes, and start the competition.  Moderate the competition during the baking make sure the competition is going correctly. Give periodic time reminders of how long the competitors have. When time runs out, taste the cupcakes from each competitor, and give them feedback about their cupcakes. After all the cupcakes are tasted, give yourself time to figure out your winner. Once you know the winner, announce it, and then if you have any prizes, give them out to the winner.
